content.text: Write the number six million and thirty in figures
Write 7.896 correct to 2 decimal places
a multiple of 16
a factor of 24
a cube number
a prime number
From this list of numbers, write down
Put one pair of brackets into this calculation to make it correct
By writing each number in the calculation correct to 1 significant figure, find an estimate for the value of
You must show all your working
Calculate \((8 \times 10^{6}) \times (3 \times 10^{-2})\)
Give your answer in standard form
Write 2160 as a product of its prime factors
Find the value of \(x\)
Give a geometrical reason for your answer
Find the value of \(y\)
Give a geometrical reason for your answer
Find the value of \(z\)
In the diagram, \(BCG\) is a triangle
\(ABCD\) and \(EF\) are parallel lines
Write down the mathematical name for the line \(XY.\)
Write down the mathematical name for the line \(SR.\)
Toby thinks shape \(RST\) is a right-angled triangle
Give a geometrical reason why Toby is incorrect
\(R\), \(S\) and \(T\) are points on a circle, centre \(O\)
Line \(XY\) touches the circle at \(T\)
Write down the percentage of people aged 60 to 69 who use a bicycle
980 people in the survey are in the 30-39 age group
Work out how many of these people use a bicycle
The bar chart shows the percentage of people in each age group who use a bicycle
Jack makes 18 cycling trips in one year
Each cycling trip lasts 23 minutes
Find the total time Jack spends cycling in this year
Give your answer in hours and minutes
Complete the table
Complete the pie chart to show this information
The table shows where 240 people cycle the most
A bicycle costs \(720
Carlo pays one-fifth of the cost as a deposit
He pays the rest of the money in equal monthly payments of \(16
Work out how many monthly payments Carlo makes
Jack does a survey about cycling
A parallelogram \(ABCD\) has sides \(8\mathrm{cm}\) and \(6\mathrm{cm}\)
Lines \(AB\) and \(BC\) have been drawn
By constructing triangle \(ACD\), complete the parallelogram
Use a ruler and compasses only and leave in your construction arcs
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
On the grid, draw the image of shape \(A\) after a rotation, \(90^{\circ}\) anticlockwise, centre (5, 1).
The scatter diagram shows positive correlation.
Is this statement true or false?
Give a reason for your answer
because
On one journey, the cost per kilometre travelled was much more expensive than on all of the other journeys
Draw a ring around this point on the scatter diagram
Draw a line of best fit on the scatter diagram
Another journey is \(8\mathrm{km}\) long
Use your line of best fit to find an estimate for the cost of this journey
The scatter diagram shows the distance travelled and the cost for each of 12 taxi journeys
Calculate how much Arit pays if they share the cost equally
They decide to share the cost in proportion to the distance they each travel in the taxi. Arit travels \(12\mathrm{km}\), Luke travels \(3\mathrm{km}\) and Marie travels \(7.5\mathrm{km}\)
Arit, Luke and Marie share the cost of a taxi journey
The cost is \(26.40\)
Work out how much milk he uses
The mass of all the ingredients Tom uses is 1100 g
After Tom heats the mixture, this mass reduces by \(15\%\)
Find the mass of the mixture after heating
Tom lets the mixture cool to \(5^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
He then puts it into a freezer to cool to \(- 18^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
Find the difference in these temperatures
This is a recipe to make ice cream for 6 people
270 ml cream
270 ml milk
100 g sugar
4 egg yolks
Tom makes ice cream for 10 people
In a factory, a machine fills 25 920 tubs of ice cream in 8 hours
Work out the number of tubs the machine fills in 1 minute
A pack of ice cream contains 6 tubs
There are 120 packs on a tray
There are 24 trays on a truck
Work out how many tubs of ice cream are on the truck
Complete the table
One week Mario sells 450 ice creams
Find how many strawberry ice creams Mario expects to sell
The probability that any customer is an adult is 0.7
Mario sells ice creams in five flavours
The table shows the relative frequency of some of the ice cream flavours Mario sells
Mario sells three times as many chocolate ice creams as banana ice creams
Find the perimeter of the triangle
The diagram shows a shape made from rectangles
Calculate the area of the shape
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle \(ABC.\)
Calculate the area of the triangle
Calculate the volume of a sphere with diameter \(5.25 \mathrm{cm}\)
[The volume, \(V\), of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\).]
Write down the mathematical name of the solid
Find the volume of the solid when \(x = 4\)
Write down an expression, in terms of \(x\), for the volume of the solid
Find the value of \(x\) when the volume of the solid is \(360 \mathrm{cm}^3\)
The diagram shows the net of a solid
Complete the table of values for \(y = 2x^{2} + x\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = 2x^{2} + x\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\)
Use your graph to solve the equation \(2x^{2} + x = 30\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 5\)
On the grid, draw a travel graph to show Samir's whole journey
Calculate Samir's average speed for the whole journey
Samir leaves home at 2 pm
He jogs \(6\mathrm{km}\) to a caf at a constant speed of \(8\mathrm{km}\) per hour
He stops to rest for 1 hour
He then walks back home at a constant speed and arrives at \(4.36\mathrm{pm}\)
Solve
Simplify
Expand and simplify
